description: Foods are good overall, like some better than the others. The pumpkin curry is very yummy. Dish can sometimes take a while to make, but other wise never had bad experience. Would recommend anyone looking for a good bite!
author: J Y.

description: Me and my bf was on our way home (oregon) from LA and we decided to stop by SF for a night. Im so glad to stopped by this place. It was on Xmas day! But the place was pack with a lot of ppl. Dont have to mention about the food. I was always think that LA is the best place for THAI food, i was wrong. I spent couple days in LA and had thai food couple times. I have to say that non of those place is as good as this thai place in SF. If i have a chance to stop by or go to SF i will go back here again for sure.
author: Fritzie K.

description: Very cozy place with polite and friendly staff. Food is extremely delicious. We tried fish cakes, chicken eggplant and sticky rice with ice cream. Everything was very nice. Definitely will recommend this place to our friends!
author: Liubov S.

description: Food tastes great, there combo deals are really good for its price for all the authentic food you get. Will order here and recommend always. Thanks
author: Daniel Y.

description: Tried to order take out tonight and was told that I needed to call back in 5 minutes because they're very busy. I called back 5 min later, and was told that they're closing and I can't order. I explained that i was told to call back; he repeated that they're closing and refused to take my order.
author: Yumi K.

description: The food here is good although it was way better when it use to be Racha Cafe. Service on the other hand is ridiculous. First of all the waitress took forever to take our order, then once she finished she took the order of the table next to us and when the food came out my father and daughter got theirs first. We noticed that all the food the table next to us ordered was coming out while me and my fiancé were still waiting for our food. It's like we had to pull teeth to get some sort of service around that place. At the end of it all the waitress with the bandana on her head had the nerve to ask us if that was her tip!! Excuse me??? If she knew how to do her math correctly she would be able to tell her tip by the total on the receipt. She's lucky she even got $5 for the nasty service we got. Horrible horrible service too bad cause this use to be one of my favorite Thai restaurants.
author: Kat A.

description: I live in south lake tahoe and a lot people like to say bay area food is better, since i really like thai food n we decided to give it a try this place base of my friend recommendation, It was okay not that great as i expectation... Me n my wife ordered tomyum noodle soup n bees noodle soup..  I had some thai food in south lake tahoe and is way more better than this place.. And service was ok but not that great..
author: Yulius F.

description:
snack:

food: boat noodles. i heard of this a while now and i finally get to try it. the greatest thing? i wouldnt say so, but definitely good. maybe i needed more since i ordered a small bowl only. a small may be a little bit bigger than the rice bowls you get in chinese restaurants. there were a lot of herbs and flavors going on in the broth. you get to choose your type of noodles and i went with the flat noodles. ***4/5

service: server was great. she saw me came in, greeted me and got me a menu right away. i knew exactly what i wanted and she got my order fast. ***5/5

atmosphere: some hobos standing near their doorways 3 times i walked by. not that it deterred me from going in, but questionable. once you get inside, it's fine. they have a tv and lots of tables. some of the workers were prepping some food in the back table. ***3/5

value: i had the small bowl and it was very small. to try is definitely fine and especially at that price. but cant say about their regular size meals. ***4/5
author: Andy Z.

description:
A-OK.

Wings of love - deep fried chicken wings in house sauce, yum!
Pad kee mao kai - spicy chicken noodles: pass.
Red duck curry - tasty, love how the duck is boneless!
Rice - dern it, i hate it when rice isn't included!

Very open, casual place; not intimate or date-ish. Service was great -- they asked if I didn't want bell peppers in my noodles since I didn't want it in my curry. Yes! Wish more servers would notice that kind of thing. And why is it that they never list ALL the veggie they put in it!? Anyway, otherwise was fairly standard Thai food.
author: Christine L.

description: One of the most authentic (and affordable) Thai restaurants that I've tried in SF.  I tried 4 things (boat noodles, pumpkin curry, pad see ew, one other thing I forget), and each was full of flavor, properly spiced but not overly spicy.  A couple were a bit oversalted to my liking, but overall a solid option for Thai food.
author: Josh Q.

description:
I bought a restaurant.com coupon for this place and decided to use it recently.

We ate here on Friday night, ambiance was good, but the location was a little ghetto.

We ordered pad Thai, BBQ pork plate, and Green Sea (seafood green curry). The food tasted pretty good. The pad Thai was on the small side.

When the check came and I tried to use my coupon, the lady said we can't use it because we can't combine the coupon with promotions. She said that the Green Sea counts as a promotion because it is a Chef's Special. What???? 

It was obvious bullshit. They are shady for publicizing their restaurant through a coupon deal then finding a random reason to not honor the coupon.

We won't be back.
author: Kimberly F.

description: Had the glass noodle salad, boat noodle, duck noodle... All really good! Pretty close to what we had in Thailand
author: Kym L.

description:
We were feeling oober lazy the other night while at my sister's place and decided to order-in with Zen Yai Thai.

We ordered:
- Larb Kai (Spicy Chicken Salad)
- Pad Se-Ew Kai
- Green Curry Chicken

The Larb was bright, "citrus-y", pretty good flavor---but tasted like ground pork. Pad Se-Ew was average--nothing to write home about. As for the Green Curry--WHOA, that's A LOT of ginger flavor! If you're not a big fan of ginger, you should probably pass on this one. We also asked for all items to be spicy though they all were quite mild. Bummer.

Delivery was pretty fast and prices were cheap.
author: Nam N.

description:
Had dinner at Zen Yai Thai because of a mistake-it was exceptional!!! 
The Zen Yai Fresh Rolls were the best Thai rolls I've ever had. The Rama Chicken I had as my main was just okay, but the peanut sauce, (which also came with the rolls) which was light in texture yet still full of peanut flavor, made it a whole lot better.
author: Larry C.

description: This restaurant located next to the Sierra Club offices is worth 3 stars, for A-okay. They use fancy dinnerware and the space inside is very clean. You get good value for the price (most entrees are around $6.50), the food was okay/decent. But in my opinion the quality cannot compete with nearby restaurants Lers Ros Thai (LRT) or Thai House Express (THE).
author: Luis C.

description:
I have eaten here a lot and have never had a bad meal.
Everything is so fresh and seasoned perfect.
I always opt for brown rice and it is so good.
The staff here is one of the best staff's I have come across in the Bay area, real sweet and genuine.
Friends rave about the cashew chicken dish 
as a veggie lover- I get the tofu, veggie and peanut sauce and am never leaving dissatisfied.
The best part about this place is for sure the prices. Maybe because it is on the edge of the TL or because they are just so rad- their prices are soo low for what you get, I'm talking a $6.50- $7.50 lunch! wow bliss
author: Tara S.

description:
The boat noodles are great, as are the tom yum noodles.  Ask for the pad thai noodles as the starch, they just feel more right in the broth than vermicelli.  The proportions are fantastic - not too much.  

They have pretty nice fried chicken as well.
author: Di Yin L.

description:
This Thai restaurant tucked in Little Saigon really calls out to me. After missing two social events on this long Friday that felt more like a Monday, and being subject to typical 50° SF wind chill nipping at every centimeter of exposed skin, nothing quite lifts the spirits like sipping pipping hot Tom Yum Soup in the company of native Thai speakers, and Thai pop (which unexpectedly sounded like Korean/Japanese/Chinese pop but with the lead crooning in a different tongue). There's a bottle on the table with the characters "llN". I'm still trying to figure out if it's fish sauce, soy sauce, or some Thai special sauce.

Zen is incredibly clean, genuinely surprising given its price point and food quality. I'm starting to feel the dressings of a fancy Thai restaurant are completely extraneous, providing little experiential value at too much cost.

Soup is ultra flavorful and clear - and who can hate a place where "medium hot" can have you contently breathing fire for a few teary-eyed minutes?

HUGE bowl of soup + fluffy steamed/sticky rice = $11 incl tax & generous tip!
author: Christina J.

description: love this place good food good service wil return
author: Leigh G.

description: I've been here so many times and never been disappointed with the boat noodles soup! It's test very much like authentic thai style.
author: Saifon L.

description:
I went there last Friday after work expressedly to try their boat noodle soup.  Ended up being happily wowed by all the items ordered.  Be aware, though, that the boat noodle soups are only mentioned on a rather nondescript piece of paper taped to the wall above a table, which was the only table that was occupied in the whole restaurant when I was there, so of course i did not want to appear rude by going over and reading it while the customers are still there.  After much discussion with the friendly but English-language challenged waiter, I managed to order the pork boat noodle soup (they also have beef).  Along with that, I ordered the following:  seafood with snap peas and green beans with basil sauce, broccoli with tofu and half of barbeque chicken, entirely too much food for two, but i got carried away... I ordered them all to go.

The soup was just delicious!  There are so many interesting and tasty ingredients in the soup and the stock only has a faint reminder of its bloody origins.  The seafood dish was also full of flavors and was served with just a hint of spice, per my request (thank you Mr. Waiter!)  The broccoli was almost buttery and cooked to a perfect texture (did they really use butter with it?) and the chicken was moist and succulent.

Everything was so good that we happily ate the leftovers for our dinner the next day.  A most yummy and economical weekend!
author: Yvette F.

description:
My "go-to" neighborhood Thai joint!  The Tenderloin is full of great, affordable restaurants - especially the Vietnamese joints in Little Saigon on Larkin Street.  And there are a number of Thai places - some of which have raised their prices as more affluent San Franciscans discover the Loin's bars and nightlife.  

Zen Yai Thai never disappoints - whether for take-out or an in-restaraunt experience.  The food is fresh, the rice is included (which is becoming less common these days) and there is a great variety of vegetarian options on the menu as well for your veggie friends.  The drunken noodles (Pad See Ew Kai) and the Pad Thai are reliably delicious. The service and the presentation of meals is always top-notch.  And while the ambience of the actual restaurant is not going to compare to a more upscale place - you will leave full, satisfied and with enough  money left in your wallet to go have some drinks at any of the great local surrounding bars.
author: Eric S.

description: This place is really good! I made my requests on what I didn't want in my entree and it came out perfect! Fast delivery! I will be ordering from here again for sure!
author: Bruce A.

description:
Holy Jesus that was so boring. Actually, if this Jesus guy really did have the magical powers I've heard so much about he'd have flown down here on his unicorn or whatever and fixed this plastic container of boringness. Seriously, if he can turn water into wine and shit I imagine he can make this food taste better. Wave a Jesus wand and make this food not taste like if "meh" and "blah" hooked up and had a bastard child.

Lame, I'm so disappointed in myself. I always tell people to trust their instincts, and my gut feelings have consistently walked me by this place I don't even know how many times without even taking a look at a menu. But I was in a hurry and decided hey, lets keep this ever growing Thai food addiction going and try another new spot.

Pros? Um, the veggies were cooked OK.. Also they manned up and fixed something for me before I got home and found out myself.

Me: "It's spicy right?"
Dude: "Um yea"
Me: "OK, but I really like it spicy, so I really hope it is"

I'd been having bad luck lately, asking for spicy and getting no such thing.

Dude: "Did you say that on the phone?"
Me: "You bet"
Dude: "Let me get you some more chillies..."

So yea, decent vegetable cooking skills and will give spare chilies if you ask . Or, maybe they could just make it spicy when someone asks for it in the first place? Crisp yet cooked vegetables are a plus, but if it tastes like nothing what's the point. Where's some Jesus magic when you really need it?
author: Justin N.

description: Do NOT order delivery service from this place. I ordered a beef pad se ew and pumpkin curry over the phone and was assured it would come within an hour. 1 hour later I called and they said the delivery man just left.... 40 mins later I called back and they assured me it was still on the way...40 minute old curry?! Just cancelled and will not be calling back. It's a shame because I've eaten here before it was perfect.
author: Kalong W.

description:
Like a gleaming Christopher Radko ornament in a Christmas Tree full of dollar-store globes & icicles, Zen Yai Thai stands out in a TL full of dime-a-dozen Thai restaurants.

The prices are ridiculously cheap ($7-10 for family style entrees, a dollar less as a rice plate (and that comes with crisp iceberg lettuce salad)) and the portions are modestly average (more than how much Osha Thai will give you for double the price)

USEFUL TIP: The condiments tray is VERY comprehensive: jalapenos in vinegar, ground peanuts, wet chilli sauce, a bottle of fish sauce (!!!) and a dry-ish oil-based chilli sauce which is ABSOLUTELY SPECTACULAR and will Katy Perry all over your mouth like a Firework.

2ND USEFUL TIP: Get this: Nuer Prig-Khing which is sauteed string bean, snap pea with string bean sauce. Even though it does not say so, this dish is chock-full of seafood (scallops, scramps, squid) and the sauce is intensely flavorful.
author: Joshua L.

description:
The best typical "Thai Noodle Boat" In SF and that's why this place is known for among Thai people in the city (trust me, I'm one of them!) 
It's very authentic and exactly the same you get it in Thailand. I recommend ordering the small portion option (like tapas plate) 

I feel really bad for so many non-Thai customers who come here and have no idea how to order it, so I just wanted to help :)
So have an opened mind and try something different than your usual curry or pad Thai that you can find in any other Thai place and you won't regret it!
author: Aphrodite L.

description: Their pad Thai is amazing! But they are best known for their noodle soup. Large portions of good food for a low price (by SF standards), what is there to complain about?
author: Carol T.

description:
place was pretty empty when i went... was during like 6:00pm but eh.  anyways my cousin and my mom ordered the combo which included pad thai, curry, salad and wontons.  dad got the pad thai, i got the egg noodles with bbq pork.  
my thing came first, portions were a bit... on the smaller side for me but probably would be average for other people.  the sauce they used was perfect and i loved it.  the bbq pork was really tasty and i loved it.  only complaints are that it was kinda small and more variations in the ingredients would be nice... it was just lettuce, pork, and noodles... then later i realized theres really no way a restaurant could mess up this dish...

tried the pad thai which was really good except the tofu... but otherwise, it was pretty good... the curry was eh.  didn't think it was anything special.  

i'd come back again if there weren't a billion other restaurants to try in san fran.
author: Justin C.

description: A-OK, so the 3 star rating goes, about sums it up.  We ordered delivery on a Thursday night.  It arrived super fast and piping hot, but I just wasn't that impressed with the quality of the food.  We tried the pad thai and one the chicken with black bean/garlic sauce and veggies.  Both were just OK, I've had far better in the area for about the same price.
author: Brianna M.

description:
Thai Beef Boat Noodles and Yen Ta Fo FTW!

I always order one bowl of each in the small size.  This way, I get to eat both!  I love it here and even though it's in the TL, I will risk my life to eat here.  JK, its not that bad!

I don't know what to say but give it a try and if you love noodles, you will love this place.  A plethora of flavor just bursts from the food.
author: lucie l.

description: Was not impressed. Ordered delivery so maybe that was the issue. Had the pineapple friend rice and it was soggy and bland, the chicken curry was flavored ok but seemed to use the cheap parts of the chicken you wouldn't want. Won't go back, Modern Thai was better and cheaper.
author: Megan D.

description: Excellent spicy chicken rice plate.  My girlfriend got the wonton soup, was also delicious.  She always orders great and it bugs me, but the spicy chicken was so good that I wasn't too miffed.
author: Lindsey H.

description: Horrible customer server. Don't order food to get delivered it will either not come or take forever. Ordered food at 8, got a call at 9:45 to tell me they close at 9:30. Not the first time this has happened
author: Jonathon O.

description: This review is based on delivery; 2 hrs anytime is ridiculous. Pineapple fried rice was great and the Pad See Ew was good but quite dry.
author: Luke C.

description: We visited Zen Ya Thai on our last visit to SF. We were very hungry and craving some thai food upon landing so I immediately went on yelp looking for a good Thai restaurant. Hubby loves boat noodle so we picked Zen Ya Thai. And it didnt disappoint. I like how they have options for small bowls so we can try different dishes. We tried all three different small bowls thehy have available (boat noodle, yen tao fu and tom yum noodle) and all of them were good with boat noodle being our first choice. Be warned that the size for the small bowl is pretty small. If you are a big eater u can easily finish 3 or 4 bowls.
author: Fenny M.

description:
legit thai  food when you can't go straight to thailand
they've got boat noodle and real chilli sauce! boom!
author: Mel S.

description: This place is as authentic as it gets. The food is very tasty and the service is phenomenal. I ordered a Pad Thai which by the way came with tofu, egg, chicken and shrimp with no extra weird charge, Fresh Spring Rolls and BBQ chicken. After receiving the bill and almost leaving I told the waitress that I couldn't leave without trying their sticky rice with mango, which was a fantastic decision because it was scrumptious. I am definitely going back, especially because my wallet loved them just as much as I did.
author: Cindy G.

description: Super slow delivery time. Ordered via Eat24 at 2:33 PM, food arrived at 4:09 PM.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Flavorful. Generous Portions. Cooked to perfection.  Wonderful Service. Modern & Bright decor.

We got the pad kee mao, seafood hotpot (recommended by server) and spicy chicken & eggplant.  All 3 dishes were absolutely amazing.  

Seafood Hot Pot: consisted of small crab claws, calamari, shrimp, and scallops with clear noodles at the bottom. Piping hot.  The clear noodles had lots of flavor being at the bottom of the pot.  

Spicy Chicken & Eggplant: Ratio of chicken to eggplant was in favor of the chicken. Not too spicy, and ground chicken was moist (a rare thing at times) and eggplant was a bit soft but still delicious. Not too salty, and just right.

Pad Kee Mao: My favorite.  Not very spicy which was a bit of a bummer  but the crisp bell peppers and perfectly cooked noodles totally hit the spot. It wasn't oily either.

Thai food normally is hella quick but this place took its time - which means about 15-20 minutes (even though it was almost close to closing) and you definitely could taste it in the food. No nuked/premade stuff here. Absolutely amazing! 

If you like your food spicy,  emphasize how spicy because they might make it a bit mild thinking you're weaksauce. =)

We got there relatively late and to my amazement the staff was still very welcoming. We arrived at 9:20PM (I called ahead and they told me kitchen closes at 9:30 - rest closes at 10:00PM).  We ate in a hurry and left the restaurant at 10:15PM and there were still people there eating (that were eating when we already came in) and the staff didn't mind at all. Our server was a doll making conversation with us she even saying she's work at a lot of restaurants but truly enjoys working at Zen Yai.

They have a bar area in case you're eating solo and wanna watch TV. =)

I don't give a shit if it's in the TL either, good food is good food whether it's hood or not! 

This WILL be my Thai spot to go to when I hit up the bay area. Yea-yeah!!
author: K D.

description:
This place can seat a large party of 10-12 people at the last minute.  The prices are average for the city but they have a cute "tiny" version of soup noodles.  

The Thai ice tea ($2.00) was served in a larger than usual glass.  The flavor was a bit diluted, possibly with too much ice or not strong enough tea.  I didn't see alcohol on the menu, be aware of this if you are planning an event with alcohol-phile friends.

I ordered the "tiny" size Tom Yum soup noodles ($3.50) noodles and "tiny" size Pork Blood Soup noodles ($2.50).  The Tom Yum soup noodles were decent, with enough tartness but not very spicy (to my tastes).  The pork blood soup noodles were sweeter than I expected.  This was a good way to sample more than one dish.  I enjoyed the Tom Yum Soup Noodles more than the Pork Blood Soup Noodles.

The crab fried rice was strongly crab flavored.  It was one of the nicer crab fried rice dishes I've had.  Color was great, and not at all oily.  

Desserts were prepackaged in clear plastic containers.  We had 2 different coconut flavored round custard desserts.  Both tasted strongly of coconut milk, with a splash of salt or plum salt.   

1.5 stars for the weak Thai Ice Tea, 3 stars for the Tom Yum soup noodles, 2 stars for the Pork Blood soup noodles, 4 stars for the crab fried rice, and 3 stars for the desserts.  I would not come here again (not by myself for the food only), but may come here if I need to entertain a large party on limited notice.
author: Ed K.

description: so good. parking right out front. mini bowls of noodles, so cheap ranging from 2.50-3.50. service was good too. chili sauces were good. crab fried rice tasted LEGIT. ill be back.
author: Jan Y.

description:
The restaurant is spacious and the waitress was pretty attentive.

Glass noodle, basil chicken, bbq pork, and their soup are pretty good. On my recent visit, I tried their duck curry and seafood hotpot. Their duck red curry is really good, it has a perfect amount of spice. The seafood hotpot is ok... nothing too special.

This place always looks a bit empty, I'm not sure why. I guess there are too much competition in Tenderloin area for Thai restaurants...
author: Novalina N.

description: Bombass Pad Thai! Really friendly waiters. Let me use their electric socket too. And they have baked goods at the front, like they do at Asian supermarkets. They looked really yummy, but I didn't get to try any this time yet. Definitely a must try if you're looking to satisfy your Thai food craving.
author: Sharon G.

description: I love this place!! drove all the way from Sacramento just to eat here(and shopping) the best authentic Thai food in the Bay Area. I love their boat noodles!! usually get it Thai hot, and I always get what I asked for just the way I like it!! Much better than Thai food in L.A.
author: Ami C.

description: Boat noodle is to die for. Perfectly spiced. Perfectly flavored. Never had this dish anywhere else!
author: Arun M.

description:
Hmm ok this is the 8:30PM take-out review:
Average on the whole, with really late delivery service. Our food arrived cold about an hour after we placed the order ( c'mon we stay just 3 blocks away!).
I only recommend the Pumpkin Yellow Curry.. it tasted super good, even the next day!
Pad Thai was so dry and bland. Zen Yai Thai was saved by the noodle soup .. spicy and flavorful, but a little oily to slurp.
Maybe dining in would be a better experience (god I hope so!) coz I've heard only good things about this lil' Thai place.
Will still give it another try before this goes off my list.
author: Nisha M.

description: There are a lot of Thai places out in SF with different menu sets, but Zen Yai serves more of the noodle dishes... and it's AWESOME! The Beef Boat Noodles are so tasty I can't stop thinking about them since last night. The rest of the menu is equally good and the staff is efficient and friendly A+.
author: Dennis L.

description: Worst Red Chicken Curry EVER.  It was sickly sweet. and the chicken looks like it was hit by a car and thrown into a pot.  There was bones and cartilage to the point where i wondered it i chipped a tooth and something super hard.   I have had authentic bone in and skin on home-cooked before and this was not it.  Just a mess.  My stomach was doing flips a quarter the way through it.
author: J D.

description:
Zen Yai is the unassuming home for some of the best Thai noodle dishes. Folks, there is a reason that this is one of the few Thai restaurants where Thai people eat in SF. 

Zen Yai is the home of the famous Thai boat noodles, served in a boat-shaped bowl. The Boat noodle dishes have a hearty soup base flavored with beef blood to add thickness and flavor. Slices of beef, beef balls, been sprouts, pork rind chips, and green vegetables (morning glory or Chinese gai lan, depending on season) are added to this delish broth. Lastly, pick your pleasure when it comes to the type of noodle you desire, and order either with soup or dry noodle. I prefer the cellophane if I order with broth, and flat (hand-made square) if I order dry noodle. 

The dry version with flat noodle is my favorite. You can order with or without prik (chili pepper). I prefer to order without then add back using the condiments for personal taste. 

Another cool aspect of this place is that you can order Thailand-sized portions (small bowl) or a larger bowl. 

5-Stars for the Boat Noodles !!!
author: Gregory C.

description: My pork pad see ew was pretty ok but I think I'll try something else here next time. My friends say it has prety goood noodles. maybe i'll try the noodle boat or something next time.
author: Thy D.

description: Yummy!! The best Thai noodle,and Thai dessert,and open until late night.i can feel Thailand in my mouth.
author: Oat V.

description:
We tried a typical get-to-know-you sampling of Thai favorites: 

 . Thom Kha 
 . Pad Thai
 . Panang

Perfectly balanced. Silken texture. A wonderful find. Not mind-blowing, but solid.

(Most of the bad reviews are about delivery or spiciness).
author: Jackson B.

description: I'll be coming back again when I want some Thai food in the Civic Center area! Very reasonably price and good food. The pad thai was a bit sweet, but my parents really liked the chicken curry and I liked the pineapple fried rice. The iced coffee isn't that good. I drink coffee like once a month so I'm not an expert, but my dad who drinks about 2 cups per day didn't like it either.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Awful. Ordered delivery that was supposed to take between 30-45 mins and it took an hour 45. Food was cold and tasted awful. The pad thai had only 2 small pieces of chicken and it lacked any kind of flavor. The fried chicken wontons were gross. I will never eat here again.
author: Jessica M.

description:
I hesitate to give them more than three stars, given the amount of competition they have to deal with in this area--there's a lot of good Thai joints within a one mile radius.  Nevertheless, it's average Thai food at good prices.  Service was fine, and they did well keeping my water glass full when my dehydrated self was constantly emptying it.

The interior is plain, with a white and red paint scheme.  The wooden tables could use an overhaul, but as long as the dining area is clean, the aesthetics don't bother me much.  

Open everyday, they also offer free delivery ($15 min.).
author: Marsha Z.

description:
I ordered vegetable tofu green curry, fresh rolls, and the spicy chicken plate. Delivery time was 45-60 minutes. At the one hour mark, I called to ask how long it would be. I had not eaten all day and was starting to eyeball my goldfish. 

ZY: Name?
I gave it. 
ZY: Address?
Gave it. 
ZY: Ummm...address?
Gave it again. 
ZY: Ummm...name?
I gave it again. 
ZY: Was it an online order?
Me: Yes, I placed it an hour ago.
ZY: Oh uuuuh it'll be 20 more minutes. So sorry. So sorry. *click*

Half an hour passes. I call back and get the same "name? address?" song and dance. This time ending with: 

ZY: Was it an online order?
Me: Yes. It is still an online order.
ZY: Umm when did you place it? 
Me: An hour and a half ago. I'll just cancel it. Don't worry about it.
ZY: Oh uh, it already left the restaurant so it can't be cancelled. So sorry. So sorry. *click*

So I am pissed off. Wait another half an hour. Call back. Tell them to cancel the order. They pass the phone from one employee to the other. About five minutes into this run around and two hours after placing the order, my door buzzer sounds.

I am fussing about the whole thing to my roommate before answering the door. He couldn't believe that our food really took 2 hours and the only thing I got for it was quick "so sorry"s before being hung up on. The poor delivery kid must have heard me because he didn't waste any time running away after handing over the bags of food.

Then there is the product they are selling. The curry had wilted something in it. The spicy chicken was gristle and chunks of jalapeno that all turned into a jellied brick in the fridge. The fresh rolls were not bad, but they weren't really good either. That and they weren't rolls. They were rolled up then each had several slices thru it causing them to all be an open pile of filling. The brown rice, well, ya can't fuck up brown rice. I cannot tell you which item specifically is responsible or if it was a combo of them that caused it, but without being too graphic, I have Thairrhea. 

Other reviewers seem to like it. Other reviewers seem to have had pleasant experiences with this place. I could have given them a second shot even after taking two hours with no explanation or sincere apology or care at all for a paying customer of theirs IF the food had not been so terrible. At any rate, I will be ordering from one of the other million Thai spots from now on. Since I cannot think of anything witty, rhymey, or clever to end this review, I'll end it with Zen Yai can bite my aching ass.

End.
author: Preston S.

description:
I can't believe I walked, drove and rode by this place literally hundreds of times without trying.
Fail.

This is another one of those Thai restaurants serving authentic Thai food.
Proper service, decent atmosphere; nothing out of the ordinary, but clean for a small TL joint.

Food is awesome though, and I recommend trying everything!
But more specifically, don't miss the Thai Boat Noodles. These are small bowls of noodles and beef that are very good and only $2.50. Unless you're not that hungry, one won't fill you up, but 2 might, and they're always a good thing to order to complement an appetizer or even a full size dish!

Only downside is the crappy area and lack of parking but I can just walk there from my place, so I don't care. There.
I will go back.

Also, this place goes into my "Authentic Thai food in SF" list; on a funny note, it is, like all the others so far, located in the same 5 blocks radius!
author: Vithiet L.

description:
I've come to this place twice, and both times, I really like their food.

Their Pad Thai had to be the most moist tasty Pad Thai I've had in a while!  Everything I ate was vegetarian, and they made it awesome!

One things for sure, they do not kid around with their spice, and I really like that!  I am dreaming about their Pad Thai as we speak; thus the review before heading to bed.

One more thing, Thai people seem to rave about this place, so that is a good thing!  BTW, I'm Thai too :)!
author: Andrew N.

description:
This is based on multiple orders through eat24hours.com-- I have not actually been inside the restaurant.

When they do it right, the food is great!  They can have delicious pad see ew, and they always cook the broccoli just right.  Where does the fallout occur?  On exactly half of my orders, they've ignored my specifications for how spicy.  That's an important distinction, right?  And it's part of their ordering process... you get to pick mild, medium or hot.

If they could be sure to read and follow all of the details on their delivery orders, I'd give this place at least one more star.
author: Jamie B.

description: Love Love Love especial the Boat Noodle.    The services are good and the foods are amazing~ Remind me in Thailand.   Surely,  Highly recommend Eveyone
author: jira w.

description: Food was incredible. Friendly, quick service. BYOB no problem and food prices are cheeeeap! Will deff be going back soon.
author: Patrique R.

description:
We order delivery from here all the time. So consider these reviews in terms of getting food delivered. Some food just doesn't sit well when delivered and could be amazing fresh onsite. 

Things I love here:
1. Pumpkin Curry
2. Yellow Curry
3. Wings of Love
4. Fried WonTons
5. Chicken Noodle Soup (Good for a Semi-Pho fix, not the best, but good when you are being lazy)

Things I did not like:
1. Siam Beauty (odd and cold)

I'm eating the pumpkin curry leftover for lunch right now that I ordered on Saturday and it's delish.
author: Mack L.

description:
I love this place! I have been going to this restaurant for almost 15yrs. I feel bad I still call it Racha Cafe cause I can never remember the new name. 

The service is sooo friendly and they know exactly what me and my family want as soon as we get there. 

We order the same things everytime we go:
1. Tod Pun (Fish Cake) w/extra cucumber salad sides Lol!
2. Spicy Calamari 
3. Ped Yang (Roast Duck) 
4. Deep Fried Whole Pompano 
and duh Thai Tea to wash it all down....

Comparing to Racha Days, there is a little something that is missing, but it definitely does the trick. I haven't been to another Thai restaurant that can do these all dishes and do them RIGHT!  

Racha... I mean Zen Yai Thai is definitely one of the best!
author: Tracy M.

description:
My wife and I don't usually get a chance to visit San Francisco much, but had planned a day of fun to take our toddler son to check out Japantown and Piers 39/Fisherman's Wharf.  We even invited our good friend and her son to come along.

With my wife being Thai and I love Thai food so much, we checked out Yelp and found good ratings on Zen Yai Thai Restaurant as close by to Japantown.  Many Yelpers mentioned about how good this place is and how cheap the prices are, so we decided to give it a try.  Upon arriving, we found the place opened, but not a single customer inside.  This wasn't a good sign, but we were starving and we still had hope that the majority of the Yelpers about this place are right.

We ordered two special $2.50 Thai noodle bowls (I had the yen tha fo), sauteed mixed veggies called Pad Pak Ruam Mit, sauteed seafood eggplant, deep fried chicken, and mus-sa mun curry chicken with steamed rice.  My wife thought the seafood eggplant was the only thing quite good, and I thought the mus-sa mun curry chicken was the one instead.  The mixed veggies and fried chicken were just plain average and the only thing special about the $2.50 Thai noodle bowls was the low price itself.  The drinking water they served had no ice (not even in the refiling pitcher), so it was room temperature and tasted like unfiltered tap water.  As for the prices (other than the special $2.50 noodle bowls), they are average at $8-$10 per plate like many other Thai restaurants we have been to in the Bay Area, so this place doesn't quite constitutes in my opinion to be cheap...nor would I say it is expensive either.  We didn't order any beverages (just water) and our bill at the end came out to be almost $60 after tax but before tip.

My wife and I have tried as many Thai restaurants as we possibly can, including the 7 different times I have traveled to Thailand before, and we find Zen Yai Thai Restaurant to be mediocre; just plain average.  We will most likely not return to this place, especially if having to drive all the way to S.F.
author: J T.

description:
The worst delivery experience.  Ordered 2 Pad Thai (one with meat and one meatless) and 1 cucumber salad.  Simple enough?  Not for them.

It took 1.5 hours and 2 calls in between to check up on the delivery.  Each time we called the driver was on his way.  Obviously he wasn't. (I only live 10 minutes from the restaurant, at the most).

When the food arrived, it was room temperature and the Pad Thai was disgusting.  Even the vegetarian one tasted like stinky day old fish.  How can a Thai restaurant mess up a very popular dish?  Terrible terrible terrible.

I will never ever order from them again.
author: N F.

description: Holy deliciousness. Probably the best bang for your buck Thai I've had in sf. I got pumpkin curry and some spring rolls, it's all awesome. Quick delivery.
author: Olivia H.

description: I haven't actually been to the location since I ordered delivery.  I ordered the Yellow Curry and I would definitely order from here again.
author: Dipesh G.

description:
I grabbed a pumpkin curry to go for a quick lunch the other day. The rice itself was great and the curry sauce was exotically delectable. The pumpkin pieces can oversaturate the taste of the curry, however. 

What really brought down the rating for me was the fact that the outside of the restaurant had a pungent stench of urine- every time the door opens a draft of urine would waft up your nose and it simply makes dining unbearable here. 

Service is mediocre, as they had trouble processing my credit card payment, but were accommodating with the $10 minimum charge even though I didn't order over that amount. 

Granted, the restaurant is situated in a crappy part of town (i.e., Tenderloin), but they really need to do something with that god awful urine smell.
author: Jonathan C.

description: Yes it's true this is the best take-out in SF because not only is it D-lish it's also cheap!!. Pumpkin curry, papaya salad & Tom Kai soup are my favs.
author: Rhiannon H.

description:
Very happy stomach!!!  Pumpkin curry is yum, yum, yum!!!  Considering the size of the vat of curry that came, they probably could have provided a little more rice, but maybe I just need more rice because I'm Asian!  There's never enough rice!!!

Ordered online from Grub Hub.  Took about 40 minutes for delivery and the food was piping hot!!
author: S. Y.

description:
Best pumpkin curry in the entire SF city!!! The noodles are yummy too. I've never been to their storefront but always order delivery from them. They always say it'll take an hour for delivery but then deliver in like 30 minutes. Fast delivery service for the most part.

They get minus one star because there was one time that they messed up my order and were really "Asian" about it. Made me pay extra to correct the order and asked to take back the wrong order they gave me. Really?! You're just going to throw it away... (I should've ate some of it first. Haha.)

I think they should invest in a POS system that keeps delivery orders on file so that they know my CC info, address, and my order history (it's generally always the same), so that I don't have to give it again every time. It would totally save them time.
author: Lorianne E.

description: Ordered delivery the other day... the time of delivery was perfect... not long at all.  Had Pad Thai with shrimp and fresh spring rolls. Both were delicious but the best part was the cost and portions were great!
author: Myra M.

description:
I really am going to try and write this review taking into account all 4 visits I've had since living in downtown SF.

First off, MOST of the employees are pretty personable and friendly. Some get a little sheisty when you ask for extra slices of lemon, or the tray of spices... Other than that, they fill your cups, frequent your table to check on you, and I've never found a hair in my food.

A-OK in my book. But the next time I ask for cilantro in my pad thai, please don't look at me like I'm some sick thai food ruining villain. I like cilantro, is that a crime?
author: Charmaine A.

description:
This is for delivery.....some of the better Thai food I've had. Not a lot of vegetarian options but what they do have is really good. Great for tons of fresh veggies NOT overcooked. Really cheap, great quality, great flavors. The  yellow curry wasn't the best I've ever had but it was full of fresh veggies which compensated. 

They didn't deliver the rice with the food, but after we called, they came back even after they were closed to bring us the rice. Much appreciated!

$23 for 3 full entrees and a healthy side of peanut sauce (not including delivery tip)....GREAT price! Two of us stuffed ourselves and still have leftovers.
author: Hilarie S.

description: Definitely one of the best thai restaurants in SF! It's such a gem in the tenderloin... The service was extremely helpful! Our favorite is Nuch! She is such a sweetheart... Can't wait to go back. The food is super delicious.. even the take out selections are great... they do take some time to deliver but its worth the wait..
author: Josh G.

description:
One of the best Thai restaurants in the city. You know its authentic because instead of fake Thai decorations and costumes, there's just a big menu written in Thai on the wall and a room full of Thai people eating there.

All of the noodle dishes are awesome, as well as the tom ka gai. Was disappointed in the tom yum gung though -- not very flavorful.
author: Jeff C.

description: I'm a believer of the boat noodles, deelish!  This place was recommended to us by our Thai friends who grew up in Thailand.
author: Carl S.

description: There is absolutely nothing special about this place. I ordered delievery which took an hour. I am already downtown! On top of that the delievery guy was rude! you dont ask for tips, tips isn't required! Also, the pad thai noodles I ordered had very runny sauce and almost no flavor. My coworker ordered yellow curry chicken and it came in a cup? where's the presentation?! It was a horrible experience and I will not order from them again. When I called to ask where my order was, the person on the phone hung up in my face.
author: Maria R.

description: Try the $3.50 noodles.  Eat 20 of them and get a free Coke.  There're 3 different kinds:  tom-yum, boat noodle, and yen-ta-four.  Choose your own meat and noodle.  My favorite is tom yum with sen-lek noodle and port.  Fried chicken is also very good.  Don't let the portion fool you.  One person can easily eat a half-chicken.  If you eat internal organs, order the tom-sap.  It's spicey but very tasty.
author: Menoride Y.

description:
With the slew of Thai and Vietnamese restaurants in the Tenderloin, I came in for the first time to Zen Yai Thai with a "here we go again" attitude; and my experience didn't change it one bit.

Zen Yai Thai is pretty spacey comparing it to other Thai restaurants in the area, but the ambiance wasn't all that great. The place reminded me of a school cafeteria. Even the few plants here and there and Thai decor couldn't salvage my nightmares of square pizza and carton milk.

The staff is friendly here, thank God. Very attentive and courteous. 

I also order take out here a lot for our programs and services at my work, and if it weren't for their prompt delivery and hot food, Zen Yai Thai would've received two stars, but alas, good delivery pays off.

In terms of food, try the Combination Fried Rice and the Fried Chicken over Chicken Fried Rice. They're both tasty and HUGE.
author: Mike N.

description:
I'm Thai and of course I love Thai food and always go to eat at Thai restaurant wherever I go. Zen Yai in San Francisco is another favorite place for me.  I went there with a group of Thai friends.  They have the small version of noodles dishes called the boat noodles which is very famous in Thailand.  We ordered so many small noodles bowls to try out and they were delicious.  Check this place out, good service, prices are reasonable and we can park on the street in front of the restaurant too.

They also have many different kinds of Thai dessert that you can buy to take home.
author: Cholada C.

description:
I did not have a terrible experience.

ordered special beef noodles
-there was a lot of sauce, a few pieces of gross beef
-the noodles were ok
ordered chicken fried rice
-it was really salty.
-there were clumps of salty, grainy stuff 

all the meat in the dishes were not good cuts of meat.

the people who work at the restaurant were not rude, their service was acceptable.
but the waitress came around to collect dishes and dirty napkins with her bare hands and then served other people food without washing her hands.  

the people there speak Thai, but the food is not really that Thai.  

Restaurant feels more like a cafe that is kind of dirty.
author: Candy Y.

description: Came here for the Thai boat noodles. Super. Full of bloody flavor, heat and a bargain for $2.50 (appetizer size- so order a couple). Also got some spicy riblets with rice. I'll return for more soup.
author: Anthony R.

description: I wish I didn't find a cockroach in my tom yum vegetable soup because I've been ordering from them for a long time.   I do like this restaurant and their food.  However, after seeing the cockroach floating in my soup, I just can't get the image out of my mind and can no longer bear to order from them anymore.
author: Max M.

description:
I just have a chance to review this place.  Last summer we went to the city and found this place accidentally.  I heard from other people they have good noodle soup.  My husband ordered Mussamun Chicken Curry was terrible.  The curry had no taste and was watery.  My husband notify the waitress and want to have them fix the curry, but I said no, because if it was their recipe I did not think they can fix it better than that.  So he change to  Pad Thai even worst than the curry.  The taste way too sweet and had very heavy of tamarind sauce.  I ordered Yen- ta -fo,  my  noodle was O.k.  I had someplace else better (Los Angeles).  I rated the food 2.5 star and service 3.00 star.

I'm glad we live in the south bay.  It's not worth to drive a long drive to the city just for a bowl of noodle soup or Pad Thai when we have many good Thai restaurant around the corner in the south bay.
author: Nok T.

description:
Ordered :
Pad Thai Noodle : 3/5
Chicken Noodle Soup : 3/5

Will order again : 3/5

Pad thai had too much fish sauce smell. Try other dishes
author: Rachit A.

description:
The wings of love were more harmless than passionate.

The ribs were the best, although there are only three per order.

The chicken satay were nearly as narrow as their sticks.

Yellow curry was sweetish with almost no heat whatsoever.

Delivery was rather slow, and the food came lukewarm.
author: Adam Z.

description:
FAST DELIVERY! I ordered online through grubhub.com around 9pm and by 9:27 they were ringing the doorbell!  The food is not the best Thai food I've ever had, but if I don't have to leave my house and move my car to get decent food it's a plus.  And did I mention it doesn't cost an arm and a leg for what I consider decent food?

The food arrived piping hot and well presented (for takeout).  The pad thai had some good flavor and comes with chicken and shrimp.  The pumpkin curry had large chunks of pumpkin and a good mix of vegetables.  And the Thai style BBQ pork-delicious! The pork had a little of fatty/grisly spots, but I those were easy to eat around.  The marinade had good flavor and the meat was cooked to perfection.  

Good prices and quick delivery will keep me ordering from this restaurant again! :)
author: Nita K.

description: Not bad, not great. Some dishes are delicious - others way too oily and extremely spicy (mild means blazing hot at this spot!) I got the food delivered which came within the time frame, still hot and all there! So that's always a plus.
author: S. M.

description:
I have given this place 4 chances and every time I have a "meh i've experienced wayyy better".
I work so close and I really would like to call this my go-to thai restaurant but the 2 counter people I dealt with had such lame attitudes. I asked for a tiny amount of peanut sauce to-go and the lady says "you pay extra" I'm soo okay with that so the guy boosts my bill +2.50 more and I'm like 2.50 more? Yes sir apparently they were gonna give me enough peanut sauce in a container for at least 4 people even though all I ordered was a combo B which was just for me. I obviously declined the sauce.
The combo B was ok. The yellow chicken curry had a couple bits of chicken and they of course added a huge piece of potatoe. The curry itself was bland and no spice. The pad thai needed much more hot sauce. These are small gripes that I shouldnt have to worry about. I have a strong feeling if I'd eaten inside I would get much better service and more flavorful food.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
My new fav Thai place.  Tom Kha gai was great!  Noodle soup was fantastic. Service was ok. but to their credit it was super busy and I'd say they need one more employee.  :)  

All the specials are written in Thai so bring a iphone translater app or ask.  Otherwise you'll miss some of the best dishes.

Oh, on Fridays and Sats they make a Chinese (or Thai) donut with sweet dipping sauce.  Yeah, that was good!
author: LeftCoast Y.

description: Read an article on the Boat Noodles, went in to try them last night. Unfortunately there was a language barrier with the two servers and I because I asked them 3 times to bring me the small portions of each kind, I ended up only trying two because I quite frankly got tired of asking. The first bowl from the menu was very good, I also tried the last one on the menu which was the seafood option, waaaaay too much going on in that bowl would probably not order that again. I also asked for my noodles to be spicy which neither of them were. To be honest the food was pretty average, pretty bummed.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
This place was awesome. Bottom line, good food, great prices, and nice atmosphere. 

The noodles were touted as one of the best 21 places in SFO. It is true, give it a shot, ask for the house noodles (I think its on the wall on a discrete piece of paper for like $2.50).

I was tempted to give 5 stars, but I rarely give 5...only to places where I literally dream of going back too.
author: Ben D.

description:
Was in the area and very hungry for dinner. My dad came here once before this past visit and said it was a pretty good place for thai. 

We ordered: tofu and broccoli sauté with brown rice, fried red snapper in a sweet curry sauce, and 2 fried eggs. 

I can tell the ingredients are pretty fresh-- the side salad that came with the tofu/broccoli entrée was crisp and clean. Tofu and broccoli were somewhat swimming in a shallow pool of soy sauce, but it wasn't over-cooked, which is a big plus. The brown rice could've been cooked better (a little too much water). Red snapper, pretty tasty. Good fried eggs. 

Overall, a dimly-lit interior, light business (but you can tell this is a place with many regular customers), and very friendly staff. 

Food-wise, a-ok.
author: Karen W.

description: OMG what is there to say about this place? Hands down best thai food that I have ever had. Originally called Racha Café, I'm not sure if it is the same owner or just a name change but the food definitely has not changed. Coming here is a family tradition and we will go out of our way just to get take out. The usuals that we get are the pad thai, the tom yum soup, the tod mun (fish cake), and the chili basil squid. The food is fast, cheap and SO delicious.
author: Victoria Y.

description: Zen Yai means Big Rice Noodle, and yes their noodle soup is amazingly good.  Top Thai resturants for their soup.
author: dee s.

description:
I love the food!!  The veggies are super fresh and I love all the different curry's they have..Here's what I usually get:

Whole bbq chicken...it's the best every, get the extra sweet and sour sauce.  It comes with carrot salad (simple and yummy) and sticky rice.

Crab meat noodle...this is a room temperature salad with thin rice noodles, real crab meat and carrots.  It's great, not too fishy at all and very refreshing.

Green Curry with either vegetables and tofu or vegetables and meat.  I love their curry, it's spicy but not too hot and the curry is sweet and delicious over sticky rice

When you call for delivery, be patient!  They don't speak great English but they are very nice when they deliver....it's the best Thai delivery in town!!!
author: Lisa Kim J.

description: Fresh spring rolls-fabulous. Pad Thai-wonderful. Pumpkin curry-delicious. Service-great!!!!
author: Rebecca R.

description: Just craving Thai food. There are boat noodles with beef or pork. They were very good.
author: Kawhom L.

description: My go to place for Thai. I have friend from Thailand and she says this is the most accurate and best tasting Thai food in SF. Bad location but the prices are too good to past up, you'll get your bang for your buck.
author: Isiah B.

description: Tragically, beyond belief incompetent, from the substandard food to the orders they take online that they miss the delivery window by.  Go ahead.  Order.  You'll be in for a long, long wait, and an absolutely frustrating experience dealing with the people on the phone at the restaurant who are absolutely useless.
author: Upscale B.

description:
Ive been going to this restaurant since it was the racha cafe and it is still the quality and flavor I remember. The service lacks, definetly not racha cafe service but the 5 star rate is for the food not the service. 
Tod mun= yum 
Spicy chicken=yummm
Yellow curry=yummie 

I always order the same thing and I am never dissapointed take this from someone who has been coming here since she was litterally in eutero this place is excellent.
author: Julia D.

description: I don't know who likes to cook when they are hungover, I certainly do not. One rainy Sunday I was suffering from a wicked hangover and I knew hot and sour soup could possibly cure me so I reviewed grub hub and ordered from Zen Yai, this was an excellent decision. My food was delivered in under an hour. I ordered the Zen Yai fresh rolls and wow, amazing! The wrap they use is so soft and fresh; I totally get why they are called "fresh rolls." I also ordered the Tom Yum with prawns, which was great and I ordered the eggplant and tofu which was fantastic- not too oily and lots of good crisp veggies mixed in, the rice served alongside fed me for two days after my order as did the soup, so money well spent ans Zen Yai is now my go to place for Thai delivery!
author: Natalie M.

description: I found this place to be very "Thai" from both menu- selection and the whole atmosphere. I always find some Thais eating here and that should indicate how "Thai" and how good it is. People comes here for their " Boat noodle" but I also find others on their menu to be decent and the price is quite reasonable. Not much to talk about for the decoration. And very informal service.
author: Dom G.

description: Their beef noodle soup/boat noodle is their signature item! Some could argue it's the best outside of BKK. The yen ta fo was average.
author: Mark O.

description:
I've only been here twice for the combo meals.
Combo meal #1:  Pad thai and yellow curry with a salad and rice.
Combo meal #2:  Spicy basil chicken and yellow curry with no salad and extra rice.
It comes with the stuffed wontons which are DELICIOUS.
+ ALL COMBO MEALS with tax come out to $7.60
The last combo meal that I need to try is the shrimp and broccoli, which I will definitely try tomorrow.
You can't substitute the chicken yellow curry for anything else.
Definitely a good deal if you're in the neighborhood and want a ton of food for very little $$$.
author: Meh M.

description: Had lunch with my family and requested no peanuts in the pad thai since my daughter is allergic to nuts. The paid thai came out with peanuts and I requested a new meal, a few minutes later they brought out the same dish by simply brushing iff the peanuts, not acceptable. They funally brought out a fresh dish. The food was great, only problem was the customer service. The waitress who took the order never came to our table to offer an apology or explanation. Food allergies are very serious and the waitress had a complete lsck of care for her job. Upon leaving the restaurant my husband very calmly and politely addresses the issue with her by telling her un the future to be more careful and sincere in this type if situation. Unfortunately she was in complete dinial of what happened and argued with him in front if the enitire restaurant and then proceeded to gossip and make a scene with the rest of the staff. Completely unprofessional and unfortunate. This waitress is old enough to know better and acted very immature. Too bad, great food, lousy service.
author: Farah S.

description: This place is pretty good, VERY cheap, and they deliver quickly.  If it was more expensive, I might only give it 3 stars, but it's decent thai food with prices good enough merit it's 4th star.
author: Yan L.

description: Ordered Tom yum soup, asked for spicy and also an eggplant chicken dish. Soup was sweet and the tasted unlike the tom yum I've had anywhere else in SF (and Thailand). The chicken dish was unnecessarily oily and over salted. Tried this place in hopes of finding a new thai delivery option but won't be ordering again.
author: Joe D.

description:
So clean, well lit, nicely decorated and had great service. Do cleanliness and lighting warrant the first descriptors in a Restaurant review? Yes, def. it it happens to be in the TL. Parking was really easy on the street in front and dear hubs and I were surprised and the speed, courtesy and quality of service. 

We had the Tom Kha (great), Chicken Satay (good sauce) and the Green Chicken curry (YUMM!). The potions were generous and there was enough for me to bring to lunch the next day. My favorite thing about the left overs was that the curry veggies were still completely crisp and crunchy, with a nice assortment of peppers, cucumber and green beans.

Top it off with a perfect helping of coconut ice cream with a fried banana and you have a perfect casual night out dinner.
author: Rosy H.

description: Yum!  Quick. Cheap. Delicious. Hits the spot.
author: Dinky D.

description: Came here on Sunday at 9:15PM and found out that they were closing in 15mins but the waitress was nice enough to still take our orders! Boyfriend and I ordered from the "secret menu" and was glad that I did! The boat noodle is one of the best that I have ever had! The broth is very flavorful and the ingredients are authentic! You can't beat $2.50 for a small bowl! My boyfriend said that it tasted similar the ones you would  find in Thailand! I think we found THE place for Boat noodles! Will be back again :)
author: Vi N.

description: I ordered from here for delivery so I am not sure about the place itself. The food is something that I can comment on though and it was delicious. This was far and away the best Thai food that I have had in San Francisco yet. The delivery time was a bit slow. It took over an hour to get to us but when it arrived it was still piping hot and delicious. It was a great value too. Dinner for 2 and leftovers for lunch at work the next day for $24 plus tip.
author: Frank J.

description:
This place is pretty modern and clean for being a restaurant in the TL.  The restaurant is kinda empty around dinner time, but there are a few stragglers here and there.  We only came here because of the Restaurant.com gift certificate.  We got the chicken salad appetizer, which is pretty spicy after you eat it for a while.  I thought it would be similar to a dish that i tried in Thailand, but it's slightly different.  For the entrees, we got the pumpkin curry and the duck breast.  The duck was kind of oily which some people like.  It was good, but wouldn't have been my choice =P  The pumpkin curry was my favorite.  It had good flavor and pumpkin chunks to eat.  With the restaurant.com gift certificate, we still had to pay $19-20 before tip... but that was because my friend ordered like 4 orders of rice. =P  They have some pretty good combos for lunch that were really cheap.  

If you're in the area, try it out, but don't go out of your way for it.  My only thing with this restaurant is that i don't think the employees are Thai, maybe the chef, but I didn't get to see the chef
author: Diane L.

description:
Thought I would try something different and Zen Yai seemed like it might be a safe bet for delivery. Unfortunately the food was just not good. The Tom Yum soup wasn't very spicy at all and full of stems of lemongrass and leaves that were un-edible. The Thai Fried Rice was OK, but could have used a few veggies in it. The Spicy Chicken was not spicy (even the jalapenos had no spice to them) and there was a fair bit of gristle in the chicken. 

Very disappointing.
author: Sarcastic T.

description:
Yay! Talk about value. 

Came here for lunch with some coworkers and man, it was real good. 

So I got Combo #2 and my coworkers got Combo #3 and another got the Cashew chicken. All of the food came out fast (not like re-heating fast, but "cooking with speed" fast) and there was soooo much food. Amazing. Combo 2 was Pad Thai or with fried wontons and salad and rice and yellow chicken curry. Now that's a lot for lunch. AND it was only $6.95 It really cant get better (unless it was free, but you know). The Thai iced tea was a little sweet, but very good overall :)
author: Dustin H.

description: I had my first boat noodle back in Sydney and was craving for it. Saw this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try. Really enjoyed the boat noodle and the ability to customize the type of noodle/meat/spicyness. I also like that they have Thai desserts / sweets / snacks for sale on the counter. I find it pretty rare to find these around SF. Would have to go back and try them next time!
author: Felicia P.

description:
If you have been spoiled by what you thought was the best Pumpkin curry in the world at Marnee Thai (Hi, Eli!), then your mind will be blown when you try the Pumpkin Curry at Zen Yai and realize you've been had! This is by far the lightest, most delicate, most flavorful Pumpkin Curry in all the land and I for one am never going back.

Because I am sick and Boy is the best boyfriend ever, he ordered in Thai to make me feel better. The Pumpkin Curry did the trick. I ordered it veggie-style, without the usual chickens and shrimps and it was packed full of tender kaboccha squash, crisp brocolli, carrots, red peppers, and snow peas. I couldn't be happier. It all arrived in under 30 minutes and is dirt cheap to boot. Boy seemed to enjoy his chicken curry as well. The Pumpkin Curry is HUGE and could easily feed 3 whereas the chicken curry and rice was a pretty standard serving. No matter- we'll come back for more. Plus, I think they're psychic- they slipped a sprite into our order as if they knew I was suffering from a tummyache. Great food and a mother's intuition = my new favorite place to Pumpkin.
author: Autumn K.

description:
when: Sunday night take out

My friend recommended the combo meals, in which I got pad thai, chicken yellow curry, fried wonton, green salad and rice. All for $7. The pad thai was good, and i loved that the curry came in a small tub. I couldnt finish half of my meal because there was so much food. Definitely a bang for your buck.

The food came out really fast too. It was ready by the time our transaction was done. I guess combos are pre-made so they just scoop it up. I was told that people rarely dined in, which is a shame because the restaurant is huge.
author: Rena Y.

description:
I was pretty excited to find a Thai place that delivers. As someone who works late shifts, I like the option to have stuff delivered early afternoon rather than trek to TuLan (aka, I'm lazy and I want my lunch now!). 

Their Tom Yum is great. Flavorful broth, very aromatic, the veggies are delicious. It's great!

The Thai Sausage rice was... Well, it was good! It was interesting. The rice was soft and the sausage aromatic and crumbly, sliced down and fried up nice. I liked it, I really did.

Here's what I didn't like - I order from Eat24 which is where I found Zen Yai. When I order from places like Big Lantern or Piccolo, I get a real receipt. These guys printed out the invoice they received from the site, complete with my credit card info splayed out on one side (and someone else's order stuff on the other side, no CC info, just what they ordered and their address). Not cool at all. The invoice says in big letters THIS PAPER NOT TO LEAVE THE RESTAURANT and to destroy it immediately. Well, destroy doesn't mean give it to the customer. If anything, that makes the customer paranoid. And I also don't want to know that I have someone else's business all up on my invoice either. Poor, poor service in that regard (not to mention it took a long time, despite the food being piping hot).

Great food tho!

PS. I'm ordering again today... Pad Thai and I think the spicy Wings of Love. We'll see if they repeat their performance. Hopefully, they do NOT still give out that invoice.
author: Chris M.

description: Go for the barbeque chicken and you cannot, I mean cannot, go wrong. The service is friendly and family-like. They had a 1-year old server last week -- cuter than, well, anything. The restaurant is always full but the wait is never long. Ahh... the joy.......
author: John O.

description:
They said delivery would be about 40 minutes. It was about 10.

I thought the food would be crap with delivery that quick, and it wasn't half bad. Pad sew ewe, fried chicken over fried rice, and chicken fried rolls.
author: J A.

description:
Best Spring Rolls I have ever had!!!

I think it was the thick wrap and non-sogginess that made it so good (this is NOT fried). The peanut sauce was not too thick or sweet too! (extra star for yummist spring rolls!)

Alas, the pad kee mao was bland and not hot. The Chicken Eggplant rice plate was bland as well - boo! Total: $23

I ordered delivery (from NOPA area) arrived within 45 min and a free coke (as they advertised).

I'll try the Pumpkin curry and pad thai next time....
author: Jessica L.

description:
Sweet baby Racha, i love you so...

I've been going to this place for as long as i can remember. The spicy chicken, the racha, the beef and noodles... even after the change of menu items you still tasted delicious.

Why can't i quit you!
author: Greg G.

description: I wasn't sure if I should eat here because I was solo. Usually when I have asian I like to be with a group and we share out plates. Just my luck they had a plate with yellow curry and pad Thai with rice . Curry was good but I should have asked for spicy, it was pretty mild. Pad Thai was very flavorful, noodles were cooked just right. This is not my usual Thai place but when in the TL head here. Price is very reasonable. Oh I almost forgot I had the thom ka soup was delicious. Sweat,spicy and sour my favorite! Staff was friendly and at my beckon call.
author: V M.

description: the best boat noodle in san francisco
author: Thamrongpakdi S.

description:
The first time I went here was when I lived in the Tenderloin and it was known as Racha Cafe.  Unfortunately, the first time here was not good. The food was okay, but I literally found ROCKS in my food! where the hell would rocks come from? I thought maybe a piece of the counter got chipped, but still....why did they end up in my pad thai?  I almost lost a tooth. 

Then one day I was desperate for some Tom Yum soup and my usual delivery place for lunch was closed for remodeling so I looked on yelp and found out this place delivered. Out of desperation, I called them and asked them if they had tom yum, which they did. However, they had a 12 dollar minimum for ordering so I ordered an order of roast duck over rice and a diet coke in addition....and guess what? it still wasn't enough!  So the person on the phone suggested I get an appetizer. Since I didn't have a menu, she actually offered to read it to me! what a pleasant surprise and you don't see that kind of service from Asian restaurants usually. The food came very quick, and it really hit the spot. The portions are large so I had enough food for 2 meals and it was super affordable. this time also...NO ROCKS! so I'll be back again.
author: Jade L.

description:
If you make a decent pumpkin curry and are willing to deliver it to my doorstep I'll probably pay whatever you're asking.

If you're throwing yummy chicken satay and spring rolls into the bargain, I'm yours. Period. No questions asked.

This is my favorite Thai delivery in the city. They make one of the best pumpkin curries I've had since moving here (rivaled, maybe, by Mekong and Coriander). Just writing this review is making me crave it. They're on delivery.com which makes life just that much easier.
author: Mariah K.

description:
My husband and I ordered delivery from here for the first time the other night and were really impressed. 

A. you can order online which is oh so convenient
B. It was Friday night and they got here in about 30 minutes...nice!
C. Everything was tasty
D. It was CHEAP!!! $26 with tip for 2 entrees and an appetizer

We pretty much always order pad see-ew when we get Thai and their's was really good. I loved the crab noodles but suggested heating them a little after they are delivered. Zen Yai will definitely be a frequent delivery spot for us.
author: Kandace K.

description:
This is our favorite order-in Thai place.  They always have reliable and courteous service with the food arriving within 45min, hot, without fail.  The dishes here are simple, clean, flavorful yet not greasy.  

I like that their green papaya salad is not way salty like a lot of other thai places. :) They also have one tasty Mango Sticky Rice for dessert.  

Our staple dishes from here are: wonton soup, TomYum soup, pad Thai, Pad Se Ew, and any of their veggie dishes.  The portions are reasonable, and the food looks appetizing.
author: Amy L.

description:
Perhaps the in-restaurant service and food is astounding, but I was very, very disappointed in the yellow curry chicken my husband and I ordered.

As a sauce used to tie rice and chicken together, it served its purpose - it kept them wet. But as a curry? There was literally no flavor - no mouth-watering curry aroma, no pleasant tingle to the tongue, nothing. It was watery and flavorless.

My husband loves spicy food, the spicier the better. I prefer mine mild - there are many, many restaurants capable of delivering a curry that is mild but quite flavorful.

This just wasn't one of them.
author: Linda V.

description:
It is five stars for what it is, which is a reasonable thai joint near the office.  Woohoo, indeed.

Oh my GAD, as our better-fail-in-November-idiot-box VP candidate would say.  She's (or her caricature's) been occupying my head since that SNL skit I saw last night.  It's worth looking up if you haven't seen it.

Zen Yai.  Their #2 combo was so good I can't BELIEVE it's $6.95.  Gringo special:  Yellow Chicken Curry and Pad Thai.  I had a cup of Tom Kha to start and it was velvety.  The Combo was a huge portion, half is in my work fridge.  There was nice spice in the curry but that spice rack with jalapenos made the dish sparkle.  Service was excellent.  I can't believe they boxed it for me when they're charging those prices.  And the iced tea for a buck is tasty and no-hassle (it comes with a side of extra tea in an elegant little thing).  

These guys slay the competition down the street at Sai Jai thai.  Which is why they were slammin busy when I left.  Way to run a business, ZYThai, khorb khun ka.
author: Staci M.

description: Very good and very cheap! I got the Kee-Mao Egg Noodle and it was delicious. Just the right amount of spicy-ness and the perfect portion! My girlfriend got the pad thai and chicken curry combo and it was equally as delicious. Definitely will be coming here again!
author: Matthew L.

description: This place has the best beef noodle soup! OMG... it's so good. I went here late at night with a Thai friend who recommended the place and some other friends. They're all agree if this place is the bomb and that little bowl of soup is full of goodness. I will definitely go back here for lunch, to get a larger, bigger bowl and I'm keeping it for myself
author: Cliff T.

description: The $2.50 boat noodles and the pumpkin curry were really good.. but 20-30 minutes to get food because you're understaffed?  Both Ler Ros and Thai House Express bring the food out in like 5 minutes.  Also, bringing out the curry before the rice is a major no-no.  I wish the service was better so I could come back.
author: Toby C.

description: It could have been the combination of being hungry and a sore throat, but it was the best Tom Yum soup I've ever had - just spicy enough, could taste all the ingredients, and was huge. Also had the Kee Mao noodles - impressive.  Walked out the door for $22 including tip. I'll definitely be back for the Tom Yum and will follow up this review...
author: stuart l.

description: One of the best and original taste boat noodle in SF! I really love the taste of the soup and they also provide the small portion so I can eat other dishes too! did I mention that Yen-ta-fo noodle was great too!!! ^^
author: Eakkapong J.

description:
This is in my hood, and serves good food at great price and the people over there keep smile on their face and very nice. 

What more can I ask?
Did I mention the food is good? Yes, the spice and hotness of the food is just fantastic!
author: Chacha M.

description: The restaurant sells soup by the cup or the bowl, for eat in or take out. You can buy a cup of hot and sour soup for $2.95. A good price! No rice included, but a large size froyo cup of soup is given. The food was pretty good. I thought the waitress was a bit snot-ty, as I came in about an hour before closing and she looked like she might get to lock up early. But we all have our off days.
author: Em L.

description: I don't eat Thai food much anymore, simply because a good one is hard to find, but this place has really good Chicken curry (yellow). It's really tasty and for the area, the combination plates are rather inexpensive. On a cold day, and if I forgot to bring my lunch, I'll call ahead for my order and run up the block 15 minutes later for a nice hot lunch. They also have promos with restaurant.com so whenever I get those, my co-workers and I dine in for a nice little break.
author: Annie P.

description: Not exactly a good neighborhood or the most appealing building from the outside nor the inside. Came here for Lunch during work one day and have been back quite a few times since.The soup, cucumber salad, satay, and green beans are my favorite. The food here is good and reasonabley priced.
author: Ro M.

description: I trust my Thai friend to direct me to the best of the best.  He didn't disappoint by bringing me to Zen Yai.  The boat noodles with beef are little bowls of intense flavor especially when you add the hot chiles in vinegar.  Since they are so small I usually get two bowls.  It is on a sketch block of Ellis so you are able to score some easy crack on the way out.
author: Monica L.

description: came here after my trip back from vegas. I was craving for some real authentic thai food, I must admit I was not disappointed. They have boat noodle soup for $2.50! what a deal!  although the serving is a bit small, (reminds me of the food vendors in Vietnam, the bowls are very tiny) the broth was very flavorful,  we ended up ordering two bowls each! it definitely hit the spot, it's a convenient place to eat if you want cheap authentic thai food.
author: Le H.

description:
The food here is pretty good but unfortunately the location is right by the TL. Great, right? Good thing I came early and left early. The place was empty when I got there so we got pretty good service.

As for the food, we had the chicken salad (somewhat spicy; was good by itself but even better with rice... then again, I eat everything with rice so use your own discretion), pumpkin curry and duck breast. The pumpkin curry was really good and there was plenty of pumpkin and meat. I enjoyed the duck breast more because I really like duck. I also had to order a lot of rice (coconut rice!) because I eat a lot of rice.

All in all, even though I've only been here once, I would definitely come back again. However, there are many Thai places throughout the city and this one did not really differentiate itself from the other Thai places I like in the city. Food was really good and I'd recommend this nice, quiet, small restaurant.

FYI - 2 people, 1 appetizer, 2 entree's, 4?orders of rice = ~$30-40
author: Brian L.

description: Although it's in a sketchy as hell neighborhood, the food here is very good. Tonight was my first time trying them. I ordered the red curry duck, the fried spring rolls and the mango with sticky rice. The food arrived quicker than I expected and the driver was nice. The quality of the food overall was excellent! I'll definitely order from them again.
author: Vincent P.

description: I love Zen Yai!!  This is one of my favorite Thai Restaurants in the San Francisco.  The price is cheap, portion are huge, waitress is very attentive when you dine in, also quick delivery to my home within 45 minutes or less.  I have been a going there for a few  years and eat here about once a week, whether it's delivery or dine in.   They have the best tom yum shrimp soup that I've ever tasted (and I've tried many places). It is so savory, unlike other restaurants that makes it super sour.  My favorite dishes are: Crazy Sea, whole BBQ chicken, Pad Thai, Noodle salad and mango and sticky rice for desert. The food is authentic and the owner and all of the employees are Thai.  The quality of the food is always consistent.  I have never been disappointed by this place.  You can't go wrong with Zen Yai, everything is amazing!!
author: Eva E.
