description: I came in with a friend who had a Restaurant.com coupon and was greeted by a lady who was a bit annoyed/emotionless. We ordered 3 dishes: Pad See Ew, Red Duck Curry, and Pineapple fried rice. The Pad See Ew was edible, but the noodles were a bit chopped up and the meat was a little chewy. The pineapple fried rice was just regular fried rice; we had to wave them down to take it back in and it came out a few minutes later with some raisins and a few pieces of pineapple lukewarm. The duck curry was yummy and a good portion. Overall a decent dining experience, but if it wasn't for my friend's coupon and the cheap prices I might not come back here even though I live in the neighborhood.
author: Annie T.

description: Come in a group since you're in the heart of the TL but don't let that deter you from eating here ASAP.  The menu on the wall is written in Thai only, so bring a friend if you can't read it yourself.  There's not much more to say about this delicious Thai restaurant.  Try their BBQ dishes for something different from your stereotypical Thai noodle dish... come on, if you just wanted Pad Thai you could have ordered from that bad takeout place around the corner.
author: Isaac S.

description: I went here for lunch with some friends and found it to be pretty good. The food was tasty (I got  marinated pork, sticky rice, and soup). The portions were pretty big, I ate probably around half of my food and brought the rest home (it reheated well for those wondering). I couldn't tell you what type of soup I got, because my friend ordered it for me and also because I couldn't really hear the server. On that note, the only downside I felt that the noise level made it hard to hear my friends across the table from me. Other than that. It was a good experience. Good food, nice atmosphere, decent service, and cheap prices.
author: Josh S.

description:
Some items here are not very good (e.g. fried rice with chicken breast on top).

However, late at night (after 11?) they serve JOK (Thai creamy rice congee) which was the bomb, as good as in Thailand. Perhaps this is the only  thing I would recommend here. Staff is friendly environment is casual.
author: Hanan H.

description: first time here and the food is up-par / amazing. You can taste their secret spicness and prices is super reasonable.
author: Kim L.

description: The boat noodles are delicious, very small bowls, but its only $2.50 each. The soup broth is amazing! There's even a secret off the menu item called the seafood boat noodle that only the pro's know to order. Its a sketchy neighborhood, but the draw is definitely the boat noodles, everything else on the menu is only ok.
author: Lai T.

description: Located in the TL, it's in a shaddy area but during the daytime it's nothing to worry about. I ordered a rice plate - pad woon sen. It was good except for the rice which was hard as hell. We also ordered a fried banana with ice cream which was delicious to reach our minimum of $20. I had a http://restaurant.com coupon for $10 off. This place is nothing super special but with a certificate it's worth it if in the area and the mood for thai. i've had better though.
author: Helen L.

description: really cheap and high quality Thai food.  Only problem is that it is in the Tenderloin.
author: Robert A.

description: I found this place when I was travelling in CA. I asked some local Thai people and find out about this place. Seriusly, I have been in the us for 12 years and I find that this place has the best Floating noodle in the US. It is so delicious, I could not even eat it slowly. The chef/owner name's Aey is very friendly and the service is fantastic. I am sad to say that I live in VA so it will be hard to have it again. I'll keep dreamming about it until I have a chance to visit CA again :)
author: TK C.

description: If you love Thai food and in the SF area, you've got to dine in at Zen Yai! Very authentic Thai food.  Everything on the menu was very affordable, easy on the wallet. The atmosphere is your typical asian restaurant, don't expect anything fancy but ohhmmmmgeee the food is over the top very authentic. I had the Kway Tiao Lua aka Thai boat noodle soup. Being from Dallas, no Thai restaurants serve this at all (boooo). This beef noodle soup is very very flavorful, less broth almost somewhat gravy like, it's topped with fried garlic, shallots, chili oil and pork rinds. Delish! I had two bowls, i love how they come in small sizes for only $2.50 a bowl. Therefore you can order different soups like yen tafo. Of course I had to try the Chicken Lard Na, the chef really made this with love. The best Lard Na I've had! The flat noodles are lightly pan fried to give it a slight crispiness with a garlicky flavor, gravy over broccoli, noodles and served super hot & fresh. I had a few more dishes but those two knocked my socks off =). don't forget to try a bottle of their palm nectar juice, it's very refreshing, light, tastes like soft honey. It's the juice from a coconut tree, even better than coconut water. So after walking around SF all day the food here really hit the spot, satisfied my hunger!
author: Suat V.

description: My family and I have been going to Zen Yai for many years.  We enjoyed their small version of the boat noodles a lot either with Pork or Beef.  Some of my friends can consume 3 to 4 bowls at one time and it only costs $2.5 per bowl.  They also have the desert that you can buy to take home. The price is a little high but it's good stuff.
author: Tina W.

description: Decent thai food with budget price and big portion!  I ordered noodles and my friend ordered spicy tofu and they both tasted delicious.  It is located at the weird neighborhood but it does not affect how good the food tastes at all. :-)
author: J H.

description: Went for a quick bite and had a great lunch.  I had the Tomyum soup which was fantastic.  Hot and tasty and a good sized portion.  Service was fast and friendly.  The prices are very consumer friendly.   Not the best part of town, but well worth the trip.
author: Steve R.

description: LOVE THEM.  Great food and fast.  I won't get Thai anywhere else in SF now.  Used to frequent Ozone before I found this place.  Not anymore.  Zen Yai is 2x better and 1/2 the price.
author: Eric S.

description:
Oh how I love my new neighborhood of food. I know the "T-Loin" gets a really bad rap for it's "eclectic" locals but the selection of food around is amazing and affordable! I love my Little Siam.
So on to my review of Zen Yai Thai...TEN yums up! (20 if you count my toes) I love Thai food that's more on the authentic end, as I know from my favorite Thai food place in southern California (Sawadee in Camarillo). I miss my little Thai friend back home, but Zen Yai Thai is like a gift from the food Gods. 
As I told my new Australian friend, I am always inclined to visit any place that has the trademark red Yelp sticker in the window and that's what drew me to this place when the beautiful Aussie bloke offered to buy dinner on his last night in the city... not even Thai can fully ease the sad stomach of that kind of loss but it definitely didn't hurt. 
We got the Rad Na and ...oh I forget the other dish names at the moment but there was soup and a vege-meaty dish....SOOO good. I saved the yummy soup for the next day as we had plenty of food with the other two dishes and being sick lately, my stomach is a little smaller than usual. I think the soup was Tom Kah....but I can't say for sure. I will find out!

I love that I live only a block away from this place and I think they deliver as well! 

The food came out fairly quickly and seemed to be very fresh. We took it to go and they packed it  very well for this so that it tasted as if we had eaten in when we ate back at our place of residence.

If you like good prices and well made ethnic food, definitely give this one a try!!
author: Lynda O.

description: We order delivery all the time -- the food is consistently great.  However, pay by credit card or with exact change -- the delivery boys tend disappear VERY quickly assuming whatever you hand them is tip-included.
author: Robb K.

description: Love love the boat noodles and yentafo. Rad Na with pork was good too.
author: Pat M.

description: I go here for lunch. Good food, fast service and cheap prices. They have a great variety of foods. I never tried the lunch specials since they all come with curry and I am not a big fan of curry. It's get crowded Monday-Friday after 12:30. I love the seafood clay pot and mango sticky rice.
author: Terri L.

description: The neighborhood is not too good. There's always some homeless people near this restaurant. The service is variable. Sometimes the waiter/waitress takes forever to come to your table and get your order. Food comes fairly quickly.  Dishes run about $7. My favorite dishes here are the Pad Thai, Green Papaya Salad, Yellow Curry and the Pineapple Fried Rice. The decor is pretty nice. The thing I like about this restaurant is that not a lot of people come in, so if you're looking for a nice quiet place with good and cheap food this is perfect.
author: Esther G.

description: I've been here 2'x in the past month and both times Zen Yai is had been good. I get Combo #2, $6.95 which has chicken curry, rice mound, salad and broccoli shrimp. It was a nice way to start my morning. That's right, I have Thai food for breakfast when I wake up late. I thoroughly recommend it.
author: Mitsi M.

description:
At Zen Yai, they speak english poorly (speak slowly and clearly when you're placing a delivery order) and make curry very well. (get the pumpkin curry or the barbeque chicken in red curry. Both are light and not greasy and just a little spicy.) 
I'm not sure if there's an inverse correlation; I'm sure there are people who speak english well and make curry well, and I know for a fact that there are many many people who both speak english and make curry very poorly. But they're probably good at other things. Even if they're not, they're still God's children and deserve to be loved.
None of us are perfect. For example, the people who made that awesome curry can't seem to do any better than iceberg lettuce and some shredded carrots when it comes to salad. But do you see me judging them, just because I had to repeat everything when I was ordering and because the salad sucked? You guys need to get off your high horses once in a while. I'm too pissed off to finish this review right now
author: matthew r.

description: This is, hands down, and pants down (jk) the best delivery Thai food I have ever ordered. Get the seafood on everything! I had a friend order the "Crazy seafood" item in a crazy voice, and we got them to laugh about it. Turns out the crazy seafood was CRAZY good! I still can't stop thinking about the takeout. I will order from them for the rest of my life.
author: Michelle G.

description: Sign of an inferior Thai restaurant is one that does not serve brown rice. This restaurant does not serve brown rice. Against my better judgement, I ordered snapper and pumpkin curry. Too much oily curry and poor quality fish. Never ordering take out again. Its just nasty.
author: Sun K.

description: I didn't read any reviews prior to trying this place for lunch today---I was simply wandering around on a lunchbreak from my new job, STARVING, and almost settled for Subway.  Like a beacon of light, I saw the sign for Zen Yai and went in to check it out.  The place rocks, quite heavily. I ordered the green curry with chicken, to go--they were prompt about taking my order, the bill was only $7, I was given a cup of hot tea to sip while I waited (which was the 10 minutes promised when I placed my order) and the food?????  DELICIOUS!!!!  It wasn't crowded when I went (@ like 2pm on a Weds) but I will tell you something---it should be, because its so f*cking great!!!!
author: Laura Noël S.

description: forget osha, this is the real deal.  ugh, the fact that that pervasive chain can even refer to itself as food in the same genre as what zen yai offers offends me.  shelve your expectations of lychee martinis, mango margaritas and other bastardizations of asian gastronomica.  ignore the curries and pad thais and get the noodle boat.
author: Stephanie L.

description: had the tilapia and papaya salad the tilapia wasn't what I imagined, it was sweet and sour style with pineapples and a filet not the whole fish with the dark sauce that I am use to, the prices are cheap but it's reflected in the portions
author: N A.

description: what a gem of a place in the TL.  the food was good but the place is a bit drabby.  but it's not about the place...this is about food.  i had your typical thai food but the food was not any typical kind of thai food.  it was yum....tom yum good in fact. (that's what i started out with).  then it was followed by pad thai and finished off with a rice place full of goodness...minced chicken with basil.  can we say nomnomnom!  the best part was the sweet and innocent waitress.  she had the best smile which was inviting.  i will definitely come back!
author: ismael d.

description: I get delivery from Zen Yai on delivery.com about once every other week.  The delivery is prompt (say 35 minutes), the food is always warm, served en masse and at a great price.  I am not a big fan of the pad thai, but the pad se ew (with tofu) is scrumptious and loaded with veggies.  The spicy thai basil tofu is also a winner, as are the fried tofu triangles.  I only wish they sold koo chai (chive pancakes-- soo good!).  This is a very, very good choice for your go-to Thai delivery.
author: Stanley E.

description:
i miss my racha cafe D''X

i used to come here a lot when i was younger. it was one of my family's favorite restaurants in sf. i loved the roast duck, it was the best. i actually went to the california culinary academy down the street. i didn't even realize that racha was a block away until about 3/4 of my way through the program. i used to come here after classes with some of my friends for a really good, cheap dinner. everyone loved this place.

this place was awesome and my family was so well known there.
the managers knew us and they always treated really well.

then they switched management.
and everything was downhill from there.

the food quality went down. the serving got smaller. everything got more expensive. i'm assuming they changed chefs (and basically everything else but the location) because this place is no where near as good as it used to be.

i really miss when this place used to be racha.
thats the only reason i give it 3 stars.
author: Michelle P.

description: the salad is fresh, the price is cheap, and the food is good.  i love thai food but hate paying a lot because i'm usually starving like an hour later.  the price is perfect here.  it's also VERY clean.
author: Hammer Time H.

description: If you're looking for Authentic Thai noodle dishes (especially 'boat noodle soup'), here is the only place to be in the city. On Fri & Sat late night, they also serve rice porridge (congee)... uuummm YUM !!!
author: Sean K.

description:
I have to say I really wanted to like this place... but what would you think after our experience???

- We walked into the very slow restaurant and stood around waiting to be seated. There were three employees on the floor, one was talking to a customer who was leaving, and the other two were counting what looked like a tip jar.
- After standing around like idiots with no one greeting us, we finally just sat down... and all the tables were dirty, so we picked the "least" dirty one... so when she arrived we asked her to wipe it down.
- We purchased a GC on restaurant.com and the only restrictions on there is that you have to spend $35 and you have to give it up front
- The waitress told us we had to order all our meals a la carte - but we wanted rice and salad, could we not get it??? Sure for extra
- I informed her there was 4 of us and we planned on spending well over the $35 limit, but we wanted to order what we wanted.
- She said her manager said we had to order that way... so my husband asked to speak to the manager.
- After waiting over 20 minutes, and asking numerous times, the manager was still not there. Mind you, there was only one other couple in the restaurant at the time, and they already had their food... so was HE on dinner??
- I finally went up to the counter, said look, I'm pregnant and starving, we would like to order, can we please see your manager. 
- The waitress just looked at me with a blank stare and began mumbling something unaudible... so I asked for my gift certificate back... she pointed to it on the counter then walked away.

I have to say, I was VERY disappointed in the service in this establishement. I can understand slow or even a lower level service if the palce is hopping, but there were only two tables occupied! 

After we left we ended up at Sai Jai Thai - they were busy, the service was great and the food was excellent... I suggest you walk around the block and eat there instead!
author: Tarah O.

description: We have ordered from this place several times because they have such snazzy tag lines on their menu covers - like "Crab Meat Noodle 'Noodle to Die For.'"  We can be suckers for marketing.  But what keeps us coming back are the cucumber and carrot salads, which are huge portions for just about two and a quarter...haven't ever even seen it, but am happily eating their cooking again tonight.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
Positives
Surprisingly good, very inexpensive, decor ok

Negatives
Neighborhood is pretty downscale & the plates and glasses could have been cleaner

Conclusion
Worth trying out
author: T S.

description: We made the mistake of visiting restaurant as LoveFest was ending on the 4th of October, 2008, so the restaurant was packed and the service was very, very slow. In addition to the slow service, the food was mediocre in comparison to other Thai food I've recently had The food was filling and tasty enough but just not as high of quality as I would expect.
author: Jamie M.

description: It's average thai food.  I think most of their businesses come from the people working in this area, so civic center and TL district.  Service is fast and efficient, and I say they deserve an extra half star b/c they do not confuse themselves or give bad service during the lunch rush.  I don't think I'll eat here as often if i didn't work in this area.  Cheap thai food and most of the popular items are always consistent (pad thai, fried rice, etc)
author: AhLin C.

description:
I wish there was a no stars rating. I've been to Zen Yai many times, and the employees there are usually nice. So I went back with my mom couple Sundays ago, they were the same people but their service was extremely horrible. 

My favorite dish from them is the Pad Thai, and when I ordered it last time it was delicious, but this time, it was straight up disgusting. I kept biting on tiny pieces of hard salt. Also, I ordered a Thai ice-tea before I ordered the food and the drink came last, even after I finished the food and dessert. I wondered why it took them this long to bring me a drink that's already made, so I asked the male waiter and he said please be "patient," I was being very patient, he was just being a terrible waiter. The female waitress finally brought me my drink to go when I was about to leave and the cap was broken, some of the tea got on my new jacket! I was so pissed because the service sucked, both waiter and waitress were ignoring my mom and I when we had done nothing wrong! They checked on other customers to make sure everything was okay, but they didn't check on us. Also I ordered two fried chicken over fried rice to go, but they gave us BBQ chicken over fried rice instead. I left the restaurant with extreme disappointment, this WAS my favorite Thai restaurant because I thought it had the best Pad Thai, but I know I will never go back there and be treated like crap again! 

Don't go!
author: Sirena L.

description: The food is really good and the price is cheap.  The restaurant is a pretty good size. When my friends and I went to it on 9/9/06 we went at a weird time 3pm, so there was no one there.  I highly recommend it for people on a budget like me.
author: Rob P.

description:
I highly recommend the rama chicken - just a pile of chicken, rice, and peanut sauce (and some lettuce that I usually push to the side of the container). 

Their fried chicken roll is also delicious (mostly because of the sauce), and their fried banana is ok, maybe 3 stars at best. 

I did deviate once from this order and tried the papaya salad... yick.
author: Shannon H.

description: YUMMY thai in the Tenderloin. I get Combo #2 - Pad thai (with big shrimps and flavorful tofu), chicken curry w/ potatoes (creamy and mild) rice, salad and fried chicken roll. FOR $6.25. Great atmosphere once you're inside but the restaurant can be easy to miss if you don't know where to find it.
author: Jessica M.

description: Rascha was one of the very first Thai restaurants I remember back in the 90's. Their specialty imo was their "spicy chicken" which was minced and full of crazy flavor! Although Zen Yai saved that recipe, the other dishes we had , the curry stuffed chicken wings and the roast duck were just so so. The curry sauce was good but the wings were just ok.
author: Steve K.

description:
Great Curry dishes, good but a bit slow service. I went on a Sat afternoon.
But the reasonable price and tasteful dishes compensate for the service.

Would go back again!
author: Kathy P.

description: some of my friend saied this restaurant the noodle soup very good.i saied good too but i love noodle soup from kin sen thai  much more better
author: Nina A.

description: The food was good and affordable.  Recommend the spicy chicken, spicy calamari, green curry chicken, and pad se-ew kai.  Service was very good as well.
author: kathy c.

description: zen yai is okay.  it's right by my work, so we go there every now and then.  i didn't like the pad thai, not enough noodles/too much bean sprouts, the pumpkin curry is good, and the panang curry is good.  they deliver which is definitely a plus.
author: Ray R.

description: If you want a nice, quiet, relaxing place to eat with Great service, this is a great choice! I have been there several times and the service is always top notch. Ray and Nuch are very pleasant and professional! The price is I think for the quantity and quality of food is well worth it! The crab cake appitizers are first, then I dig into the curry chicken, papaya salad, pad thai and bbq pork. Too many things for us to eat, so I usually stick with the usually winners. Then top it off with the tai iced tea. The parking is right on the street and usually get parking right out front.
author: Michael C.

description: Fast service, tranquil and sophisticated atmosphere, great food with decent selection.  I came here for lunch and while it was moderately busy, the staff and fluid service put everyone at ease.  Had the vegitarian kabocha squash curry - came with button mushrooms, zucchini, and other good things all in a smooth creamy broth.  Yum!  Easily one of my favorite kabocha dishes. One drawback is that the menu seemed a little focused on fried food. Also tried the chicken with basil and lemongrass for a reasonable price - very lemongrassy, which I loved, but also a little oily for my taste.  Fried bananas with coconut ice cream were heavenly - the ice cream was made with coconut milk, coconut shavings, and shards of little crunchy things (nuts?) that gave a nice pop when you bit into them.   You can also order online from them if you live in San Francisco and want to pick up food to go.  Restraunt.com offers discount cupons to the place.
author: Sam A.

description: never actually stepped foot in this establishment, but it's our go-to thai delivery spot, gentle reader. why? they always accommodate my "please not greasy thank you" request for the thai veggie no tofu. everything is pretty good! they're cheap and HELLA fast. like 15 minutes once. not kidding. and the veggies actually look somewhat fresh and not soggy or canned. xoxo.
author: Mary V.

description: My dad brought me and my family here yesterday. I was pleasantly surprised that this place was GOOD...like really really GOOD. We ordered two different soups, the coconut and the tom yum, both were full of flavor and very delicious. For entrees we shared, family style, and ordered the spare ribs (crispy and tasty!), the squid curry with bamboo shoots (the bamboo was stinky but in a good way), the pad kee mao (think thai version of chow fun), the pineapple fried rice (my favorite dish!) and duck. The portions were pretty big and we had leftovers. For dessert we had both the fried bananas with ice cream and mango with sticky rice. The best part was the bill...only $63 bucks for the 6 of us! It's a steal and the quality of the food is there. My dad apparently goes to this restaurant for lunch all the time and in fact, he went there for lunch yesterday and brought us for dinner. I think that says a lot about this restaurant. The only downfall is that there are three homeless bums outside and it stinks REALLY bad. It will probably ruin your appetite. So hold your breath and run to the door!
author: Vanessa T.

description: after eating eighty thousand pounds of chocolate at the chocolate festival, my friends and i needed some real food to balance it out. we decided to go to zen yai, where some of them had been before. this is another thai place, and it was empty when we went, but judging by the food, that was probably only because we went at a weird time. their specialty there is thai bbq. i had bbq chicken curry which was good - something out of the norm for what you would think of in thai food. they also have bbq'd meat not in a curry, and two of my friends tried that (chicken and ribs). another friend tried the seafood crockpot dish, which unlike some places, was filled to the brim with actual seafood. Other dishes tried were pad thai, some type of green curry seafood thing, and a rice dish. Everyone realy enjoyed their food. A lot of the dishes (including mine) come with a salad which was very tasty. The thai iced tea was good, but not great, but then again it was only $1.50 so what can you expect. Overall, everything was really cheap, mostly under $10. I fully reccomend coming here.
author: Merredith L.

description: man i was starving when i finally got a chance to eat here. there are tons of selections on the menu. i definately had a hard decision to make because everything sounded tasty. the prices are reasonable and the portions are big (at least what i noticed, including my own). thai bbq is a main focus here.
author: Nikoh C.

description: Have been here for lunch a handful of times now and I think this place offers good value and service, great food and consistency.  Used to go when it was Racha Cafe and it's just as good to me now that it's Zen Yai (although it went through a period in-between where I understand it was not good), and not at all crowded if you go early which is what I do.  It seems to fill up after noontime.  I love their combo. lunch special #2 for $6.95.  You get an unbelievable amount of food and it's all good and very filling.  You get an egg roll, small salad, lots of rice, a bowl of mild chicken curry (potatoes & dark meat, no bones) and a very generous portion of shrimp & tofu pad thai.  There are two other combos with shrimp & broccoli or spicy chicken in place of the pad thai.  Everything I've seen others order looks really good and very generous portions.  The spicy calamari w/bamboo shoots, as well as other dishes, are holdovers from the former Racha Cafe and is delicious.  The seafood clay pot is also recommended.
author: Mimi L.
